This space is for you and enriched by you.Â Â 

This is an opportunity for you to learn how you can make the most of your Kaltura video solutions, whether you are just rolling them out, or promoting adoption across various units in your organization.Â 

Share your thoughts with your fellow Strategic Account Members: start a discussion, share an idea, post a comment. What did you find that works best for you? What are your tips and tricks? What are your challenges?Â 

You can use this space to ask each other questions, point out to interesting and relevant news, and more.Â 

Enjoy!Â 

Here is a guide for best experience:Â 

CategoriesÂ 

We have several main categories which is how we organize the content in our community:Â 

  • The Kaltura Cafe has the Community welcome center, news and member introductions (open to all Kaltura customers)Â Â 
  • Enterprise is designed for discussion on video in the workplace (open to all Kaltura customers)Â 
  • General Kaltura category with our resource library and a discussion area for all things Kaltura (open to all Kaltura customers)Â 
  • Strategic Accounts Practice space exclusively designed for discussions amongst Strategic Accounts Members only.Â 

TagsÂ 

Tags are aâ€¯secondaryâ€¯method we use to organize and sort content in the community. Think of it like you're assigning a "theme" to your content.Â If you don't see a tag that you would like to use, let a Community Manager know! (@Dani or @Piper ) and we can add it for you - we're always adding tags.Â 

BadgesÂ 

The more youâ€¯do, the more badges you earn! You will earn digital badges as you engage in the community. (e.g. give likes, comment, answer questions) These actions earn you points, and points increase your community reputation.Â 

As members of the new community and Beta program you will earn the Kaltura Community Founder badge.Â 

How to ActÂ 

Be sure to check out our â€¯Community Guidelines!â€¯It has guidelines on setting the tone of the community and how to foster collaboration. It also highlights what kind of behaviors won't be tolerated. If you feel someone isn't following the guide, flag it for us and we'll investigate.Â 

Community How TosÂ 

Get Started | Ask a Question or Create a New DiscussionÂ 

We encourage everyone to get the conversation going. Ask a question or create a new discussion! It's easy and it really gets the creative juices flowing.Â 

Step 1: Click on the "New Discussion"Â Â button

Step 2: Give your discussion a titleÂ 

Step 3: Capture what's on your mind in the body of the discussionÂ 

More tips on how to use the community like a Pro:Â 

  • Use the reactions. These let you share how you feel about otherâ€™s comments.Â 
  • Mention others. Put an @ symbol before the username to mention someone. Theyâ€™ll get notified when you do.Â 
  • Update your notification preferences. Youâ€™ll receive a notification if someone mentions you or posts to a discussion that youâ€™ve bookmarked. You can set notifications from the Edit Profile page.Â 
  • Send messages. You can private message members by going to your inbox, or visiting their profile page (click their username anywhere).Â 
  • Donâ€™t want to see everyoneâ€™s signature?â€¯You can hide signatures by going to Edit Profile > Signature Settings.Â 
  • Check out the community from your mobile phone. Just go to the community URL in your browser - no need to download an app.Â 
  • Want to embed a YouTube video, a LinkedIn post or a Tweet?â€¯Just paste in the link. The Community platform will handle the embedding for you!Â

name: Live Stream Recordings & Publishing
body:
We don't use live streaming much at Michigan. We're testing a use case where we want to live recordings to land any specific Mediaspace channel or KAF media gallery. We are trying to limit the number of Livestreams we have to publish because there will be a lot of really short ones for this use case.

It looks like provisioning a live stream from KMS does not let us hit the switch to create separate recordings from a single stream. I'm also unsure that those recordings will automatically publish where I want them to go.

What are your recommendations?

PS if you're interested in the use case, we're talking about live streaming from a simulation lab to iPads or other devices and then also publishing that recording somewhere later.

name: First day back to school stats!
body:
Like many institutions, Monday (8/23) was Penn State's first day of the Fall Semester.

Fall semester starts in person this year which peeked my interest to see how did our first day compare to last year.

Overall, the return to in-person classes has significantly reduced the number of new recordings in Kaltura.Â However, Kaltura saw more unique users and videos viewed/played this year compared to last year.Â This uptick could be caused by our encouragement for users to link to their recordings in Kaltura rather than Zoom and using Kaltura notifications that their recording is ready rather than from Zoom.

Below are tables of our data for Kaltura comparing Fall 2020 to Fall 2021 data.Â There is also a graph comparing the number of new recordings, by hour, in Kaltura.

Are you seeing something similar at your institutions?

name: Strategic Accounts Exclusive Roundtables
body:
We are excited to announce that we are about to launch a unique series of round table virtual events for our Strategic Account members.Â Â 

The idea is to create a virtual space where our customers can have an open discussion on various topics, consult with one another, and share their thoughts and best practices.Â Â 

The sessions will be planned and moderated in collaboration with select customers, who will be in charge of leading the discussion in the group.Â 

If one of the below topics are of interest to you and you wish to play an active role in any one of these events, or if you have any other topics you would like us to address, please reach out to your Account Director, or simply click â€œtell us moreâ€ to send us a direct email.Â 

Strategic Accounts â€“ Round Table SeriesÂ 

The Business Case for Digital AccessibilityÂ Â 

Why is digital accessibility important? What are the business risks and benefits associated with it? And what are some tips and best practices around implementation?Â Â 

Everyone is a CreatorÂ Â 

In the digital age, and especially with the rise of the remote workplace, everyone â€“ whether itâ€™s your employees, partners, or customers â€“ have become a content creator.Â What do other organizations do? Do you lead a democratized approach towards your content creation? Do you have a different approach for Live vs. VOD? How do you combine self-serve with high production value? What are the doâ€™s and donâ€™ts for your video creation strategy?Â Â 

Virtual training and enablementÂ 

Whether to up-skill your employees, educate your customers, or for partner enablement â€“ delivering a virtual learning experience has become key for employee and customer engagement.Â Â From micro-learning, to e-learning, to customer enablement platforms â€“ what are the key considerations, challenges and best practices in delivering a remote learning and training experience at scale?Â Â

name: More options in muting audio
body:
From an end-user I got the following post:

***************

What a coincidence. I just ruined 90mins of video. :( :( :(

I recorded my screen with system audio, but to prevent back ground noise, I disabled the mic on Kaltura app. Apparently that stops the app from also recording the system's audio... Which is imo a very big design flaw!!

This same flaw also causes a lot of screen recordings to have echo on them...

So after doing some tests I found out that disabling the mic via your keyboard (FN+F4 if you are on windows laptop) does mute only the mic and still records system audio...

**************

There is room for improvement in Capture audio recording. Hope Kaltura will pay attention to it.

name: KMS/KAF: Improve ability to message users via additional msgid placeholders in the UI
body:
This feature request has been submitted as Customer Care #00356111.

Background

As Kaltura admins we struggle with how to inform KMS/KAF users about things they need to know in Kaltura. To help address this problem, here is a feature request:Â 

Feature Request

Immediately to the right of all headings in the web UI (H1 through H3 might suffice?), provide a unique but empty msgstr placeholder that accepts HTML.Â 

Justification

If implemented, Kaltura admins would be able to use the Language module's LanguageException process to add documentation to a given page. For example, in the case of needing to tell users something they MUST know, they could add a couple bullets of text below the page heading. Or, admins would be able to insert a question mark/info icon and link to the right of a page heading, to give users the option to learn more about what that page does.Â 

Related Language Exception Examples

For some examples of Language Exceptions we have implemented along these lines:Â 

Type 1: Adding important information bullets to a pageÂ 

Kaltura Express Recorder Language Exception

At the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, we had a lot of new users, and some of them started using the Express Recorder for recordings that were too long, thought it would record their desktop, etc. The Recorder module's maxRecordingTime setting doesn't warn users before recording stops which is very jarring. So, to give context around this tool, we added a couple bullet points with a link to more information over atÂ https://it.umn.edu/services-technologies/comparisons/compare-video-recording-tools.

We have click stats on that link. As seen in the screenshot below, it has been clicked many hundreds of times, especially at the start of terms when users are just trying to get up to speed with the tools.Â 


Kaltura Analytics Language ExceptionÂ 

Early in 2021 we had a few cases where instructors did not understand the limitations of Kaltura Analytics before using the data to fail students in a course. Big oof. Here's what we did to give more context on the Analytics screen:

The links send users to anchor links on the same page, e.g. https://it.umn.edu/services-technologies/how-tos/kaltura-view-analytics-about-media-usage#limitations We implemented this exception at the end of April 2021 so the stats below don't show many clicks yet. But, if even just one of those clicks resulted in a instructor understanding Analytics' limitations before accusing a student of not watching assigned videos (or at least triggering a conversation between them), it will have been worth it.Â 


Type 2: Adding an info icon to so users can elect to learn moreÂ 

Kaltura Quick Ingest Language ExceptionÂ 

Within the KAF Browse, Search, and Embed process, we implemented Quick Ingest in January 2021. Since this was a change in the short period we have between fall and spring terms, we wanted to give users the option to learn more about the new interface. This is an example of a Language Exception that adds an info icon/link to the right of a heading:

The â„¹ï¸ icon links out to https://it.umn.edu/services-technologies/how-tos/canvas-add-media-using-kaltura-rich As seen below, this has not been clicked to a huge degree, mostly just after implementation, but we have heard from specific users that they were happy it was there.


How this Feature Request Would Help Solve Current Problems

See below for a list of things we can't do currently, that this feature request would address:Â 

Type 1: Adding "Need to Knows" to Category-Wide Kaltura Analytics

When users go to Media Gallery, then go to the Channel Actions (see footnote below on that label), then select Analytics, there is no unique language here. We would like to be able to add bullet points so users understand what they're seeing better, similar to what we added on individual entry analytics page as seen above. The screenshot below shows how there are no unique language msgids we can change to add text here.Â 


Type 2: Users need a way to learn more about the Media Gallery

When new users first see the Media Gallery, they don't get it, and since there is no link to more information, they often leave, never to come back. We want to provide more context. It is possible to use the msgid "Media Gallery" to add an icon/link in context, as seen in the screenshot below:

However, doing that breaks Browse, Search, and Embed, as seen in the screenshot below:

To the right of the My Media tab, there should be Media Gallery, and Media Gallery Playlists tabs, but the trying to add a link in the Media Gallery msgid breaks those options.

I'll be interested to know how others might use this feature request, or something like it, as well.


Footnote about Media Gallery Channel Actions menu label

In the KAF Media Gallery, when users hover over the Actions menu, they see the text "Channel Actions". This wording is confusing to users, since they may have never heard of a "Channel". They are in a Media Gallery, not a Channel. We opened case #00319825 (aka SUP-23258) about this issue in July 2020 and asked about it again in July 2021. It is still pending review.


Alex Anderson @ University of Minnesota

name: Category Filter - Ability to Search for a Specific Subcategory (SUP-28726)
body:
In the KMC, the way the category filter currently works is that it will only filter the bottom-most or "terminal" category (there is probably a more official term for that category?).

For example:

If I search for the category "111111"

  1. Then it will display a video with the categorization "site: channels: 111111"
  2. However it will not display a Video with categorization "site: channels: 111111: InContext"

Currently it is possible to filter by category for:

  1. Just videos tagged with "111111"
  2. Videos tagged with "111111" and "111111:inContext"

However, there does not appear to be a way to filter for videos that are ONLY in the category "111111: InContext". This would be a very helpful filter so that we could identify videos that are embedded in a course, but have not been added to the course Media Galleryu.

If you are interested in this functionality, you can reference feature request SUP-28726Â  logged with Kaltura.

EDIT NOTES: Thanks to @mkraft for pointing out that there is the ability to include both categories and sub-categories in the category filter, but there is not a way to filter by a subcategory under a specific parent category. The feature request above has been updated to more accurately reflect the need/use case (and updated with the original Kaltura Feature request).

name: Customer Care Chat is live!
body:
Greetings,

You have been asking for chat service and we listened. Like many of you, we believe this is another channel of service that will greatly benefit our customers (and the feedback from the Pilot reinforces that belief). We successfully wrapped up the pilot and went live with chat service for all customers on August 2nd! Chat support is designed to provide fast answers to how-to questions, help with small or large issues, expedite information-gathering, or even follow-up on an existing case -- all in real-time.

Where: The new live chat module is available on the homepage of the Customer Care Portal: https://support.kaltura.com/. By the nature of thisÂ service â€“ opening a ticket with Kaltura â€“ Chat is available only for those of you who have access to the Customer Care Portal and permission to open tickets and inquires prior to the Chat service going live.Â 

When: Available during US business hours (and from September 1st during both EMEA and US business hours).Â 

How: We have a dedicated Chat Support team in place to cater to this new service.Â 

Question: Is there a cost for chat support? We have decided to include this premium service in customersâ€™ existing service packages.Â 

Should you have any questions or concerns â€“ or would simply like to share feedback about your chat experience â€“ please submit via email to: chat-register@kaltura.comÂ 

Providing you with the best possible service is our continued goal and commitment.Â 

Happy chatting!

body:

name: Howdy from the Natural State
body: Just a quick note to introduce myself if you don't already know me through the Blackboard community. My name is Alex Manly from Arkansas Tech University in Russellville, AR. Where I am the Director of Learning Technology Resources and supervise a pair of teams for Course Management Systems and Instructional Technology Services. We went live on Kaltura in the fall of 2019 after migrating from Tegrity and ShareStream, and it has been an extremely positive transition. I am happy to see this new community forming and look forward to the advantages it will bring.

name: Idea: vanity view
body: I have had several faculty who have asked for a vanity view when presenting. Some of them teach reading to student teachers and want to make sure what they are showing is in full view.

name: Media Pages Open to Anyone Despite Gallery/Category Settings and Published Status
body:
We've uploaded videos to Mediaspace. We've also created galleries/categories in Mediaspace. The category settings for privacy are set to "Restricted" (all logged in users can view...). We WANT users to have to log in to view the content.

The videos are set to "Published" (Media page will be visible to individuals according to entitlements on published destinations).

The last step is our Library is creating entries in their catalog to view these videos online. They've created the entry using the Share option from Kaltura to get the link to the media page.

However, when you click the link from the catalog service, the Mediaspace page opens and the video begins playing without any authentication. Users are not being required to log in and we need to to be logged into Mediaspace to view the content for licensing purposes.

What am I missing?
